stream_context.summary: Kaze spends most of the stream hunting a one-frame landing crash, then imports and tests Biobak’s huge re-work of Course 2 (now called “Dino Dino Domain”).  Debugging exposes both an animation-pointer bug and a hard N64 memory ceiling (the new level exceeded the pool by ~1 KB).  Kaze hot-fixes memory by ripping out an unused ‘leaf boat’ asset, tweaks render modes, and reviews Biobak’s exhaustive change-log.  He also shows a new auto-save-block, a revamped vine-jump mechanic and brainstorms a disco-ball star set-piece for the nightclub sub-area.

development_findings.summary: Pressing A one frame before Mario lands can crash the game; Kaze traced it to animation switching and possible Project64-specific behaviour but root cause is still open.
development_findings.quote: It was the animations somehow. I turned off the animations for a second and now I'm fucking around … the game doesn't crash.

development_findings.summary: Bug-fighting workflow: Kaze debugs straight in N64 assembly with Nemu64, reading registers, stepping through set Mario action and memory pools.
development_findings.quote: You might need to be able to read assembly to fix bugs like this, but if you are a modern software programmer you have different tools.

development_findings.summary: Biobak’s visual overhaul pushes Course 2 to ~41 000 triangles and so many textures that the ROM ran out of RAM by ~1 KB; Kaze freed space by deleting an unused ‘leaf boat’ model and enabling ‘bleed & inline’ texture packing.
development_findings.quote: We were using literally one kilobyte of memory too much in this level … all of that for one texture.

development_findings.summary: Kaze added a ‘save block’ in front of level exits even though the game auto-saves, believing players need a visible save interaction.
development_findings.quote: This is about psychology. I already know people are going to hit the save block, then hit it again, then turn the game off.

development_findings.summary: Vine-jumping controls rewritten: Mario now auto-aligns to the next vine and a single A-press hops across, reducing camera fiddling and difficulty.
development_findings.quote: You just kind of attach to these and it automatically rotates to the next one … I think this makes the player's life a little easier.

development_findings.summary: Nightclub set-piece redesign: star will sit inside the disco ball; grabbing it breaks the ball, halts lighting and music, and stops Shy Guy dancing.
development_findings.quote: Imagine the star is inside the disco ball and as soon as you steal it, the entire room goes dark, the Shy Guy stops dancing.

development_findings.summary: Camera & tutorial tweaks: re-adding Course 1 wall-kick tutorial, new egg-slide camera angle to raise tension, plan to teach mechanics in multiple spots.
Engine housekeeping: Kaze reached ‘zero compile warnings’ with very strict GCC flags and fixed a random N64 crash by removing old cartridge consolidation issues.
Fast64 texture-scroll runs at 30 FPS; Kaze plans to code native scrolling for 60 FPS in final build.

context_findings.summary: Kaze upgraded to Windows 11 (suspected virus) and had to reinstall dev tools, leading to GIMP and NVidia frustrations.
context_findings.quote: I installed Windows 11 about a week ago because I thought I might have had a virus.

context_findings.summary: Annoyed that viewers accuse Joshua’s narration of being an AI voice; sees it as a broader ‘AI-investigation’ fad.
context_findings.quote: I got so many complaints that I was using an AI voice in my video, when it's just like, that's just how Joshua sounds, man.

context_findings.summary: Personal note: his aquarium pleco has just hatched babies; mentioned while GIMP froze.
context_findings.quote: I found out today that my pleco baby is hatched.

biobak.summary: Delivered a complete visual and layout re-work of Dino Dino Domain: lower poly water, mossy bricks, new Yoshi camp, nightclub, garden, retro pipe area, etc.
biobak.quote: We’re gonna get a big DinoDino domain rework today. We have a lot of stuff to look at today. It’s going to be very exciting.

biobak.summary: Change-log includes performance-minded polygon cuts, texture AO tricks, scrolling waterfalls, and camera suggestions.
His extra textures triggered the memory overflow that Kaze debugged.

zeina.summary: Zeina is producing neon sign assets for the retro section of Course 15; briefly mentioned by Kaze.
zeina.quote: Zeina's making a lot of these for the retro section of Course 15, so that's gonna be sweet.

key_stories.title: The 1-KB Memory Crisis
key_stories.summary: After importing Biobak’s revamped Course 2, the game crashed on load.  Kaze traced the fault through Nemu64 and discovered the level exceeded N64 RAM by roughly one kilobyte.
key_stories.challenge: Level refused to load, throwing ‘out of memory’ in surface-node allocation.
key_stories.process: Stepped through decompression, verified segment 7 pointer, calculated free space vs. request, identified overage.
key_stories.outcome: Deleted an unused ‘leaf boat’ asset, enabled texture inlining, and the level loaded successfully.
key_stories.key_quote: We were using literally one kilobyte of memory too much in this level.

key_stories.title: Frame-Perfect Landing Crash
key_stories.summary: A mysterious crash occurs when A is pressed the frame before Mario lands.  Kaze live-debugs assembly, suspects animation pointer thrashing, and notes it might be Project64-specific.
key_stories.challenge: Game hard-crashes during certain frame-perfect inputs.
key_stories.process: Used smart debugger, inspected register flow, isolated to animation switching, toggled animations off for testing.
key_stories.outcome: Turning off animations stops the crash; root cause still pending.
key_stories.key_quote: It was the animations somehow.  I turned off the animations for a second and now I'm fucking around … the game doesn't crash.

key_stories.title: Designing the Disco-Ball Heist
key_stories.summary: During level review, Kaze and chat ideate turning the nightclub’s disco ball into a destructible housing for a star, affecting lights and music.
key_stories.challenge: Make the star collectible memorable and thematically consistent.
key_stories.process: Brainstorm live: place star in disco ball, let Mario grab pole, snap line, ball shatters.
key_stories.outcome: Concept accepted; added to to-do list for implementation.
key_stories.key_quote: When Mario collects it, the room goes dark and grey, Shy Guy stops dancing, the music stops.
